turns.content:
Web search results:

[1] "2. A fixed pitch instrument is one that cannot be tuned. It has nothing to do with whether you can play in more or fewer keys. For instance, I play the pennywhistle. My whistle is a single piece of aluminum tubing, and can not be tuned. It is a fixed pitch instrument."
Source: https://music.stackexchange.com/questions/50825/fixed-pitch-instruments

[2] "Viola. The viola has four strings (all tuned in fifths), with the lowest string being C (one octave lower than Middle C), then G, D, and A. The pitch range of the viola is one-fifth lower than the violin and one octave higher than the cello. It sits neatly in the middle of the string family, ranging from 125Hz to 1KHz."
Source: https://sloanschoolofmusic.com/pitch-range-of-musical-instruments/

[3] "Note that a sharp pitch is different from the sharp key signature found in music notation; a musical sharp means that a composer wants you to play a note that is a half-step above a note on the musical staff. 4. Flat pitch: A flat pitch is one that is a bit too low for the intended note. It is effectively the opposite of a sharp pitch."
Source: https://www.masterclass.com/articles/pitch-in-music-explained
Current date: 1/13/2023
Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: create a simple prompt where I give you the notes of a fixed pitch instrument with its limitations, provide the chords used in two cullums, one with the chord name and one with the notes.

Please be as descriptive about the mode / scale as possible. I want to eventually ask for songs that can be transposed in some way to fit my locked instrument, a handpan

A fixed pitch instrument is one that cannot be tuned. This means that the instrument is always producing the same set of notes, and cannot be adjusted to produce different notes. [[1](https://music.stackexchange.com/questions/50825/fixed-pitch-instruments)]

A handpan is an example of a fixed pitch instrument, and it typically has a set of notes that are played by striking the instrument with a mallet. The notes on a handpan are arranged in a specific pattern on the surface of the instrument, and the player cannot change the pitch of these notes.

If you have the notes of your handpan, it's possible to find chords and songs that can be played on it. For example, if your handpan has the notes C, D, E, F, G, A, and B, you could play the following chords:

Chord name: C major
Notes: C, E, G

Chord name: D minor
Notes: D, F, A

To find songs that can be played on your handpan, you can look for songs that use only the notes that your instrument can produce. For example, songs that use only the notes C, D, E, F, G, A, and B would be able to be played on your handpan. Additionally, you could also transpose songs in a way that the chords and melody fits the notes of your handpan.

Keep in mind that the handpan is a relatively new instrument, many songs and compositions are not written specifically for it, so you may have to make some adjustments to the songs you find in order to play them on your handpan.

Web search results:

[1] "These ranges correspond to the following: Soprano: C4 to A5. Mezzo-soprano: A3 to F#5. Alto: G3 to E5 (and contralto as F3-D5) Tenor: roughly C3 to A4. Baritone: A2 to F4. Bass: F2 to E4. However, in the layman explanation, according to the vocal ranges chart above. The vocal range is merely the span between the highest to lowest notes."
Source: https://www.becomesingers.com/vocal-range/vocal-range-chart

[2] "F3/C4,Db4,Eb4,F4,G4,Ab4,C5,Db5,Eb5. F Major 9+(4). F3(G3,A3)/C4,D4,E4,F4,G4,A4,C5,D5,(E5,F5)"
Source: https://www.vibehandpan.com/scales-in-f

[3] "Stream Shang-Diao (F3 Bb3 C4 Eb4 F4 Ab4 Bb4 C5 Eb5) by Muyuq Instrumentos en Armonía on desktop and mobile. Play over 265 million tracks for free on SoundCloud."
Source: https://soundcloud.com/muyuq-drum/shang-diao-f3-bb3-c4-eb4-f4
Current date: 1/13/2023
Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: F3 Bb3 C4 Eb4 F4 G4 Ab4 Bb4 C5 - id love a list of simple chord progressions and I am more than okay with modifications. These are the only notes available to me, so if I need to omit or adjust certain notes to make it playable thats ok

The notes you've provided, F3, Bb3, C4, Eb4, F4, G4, Ab4, Bb4, and C5, correspond to a specific scale, which is a set of notes arranged in a specific pattern. The scale you've provided is the "F Major 9+(4)" scale. [[2](https://www.vibehandpan.com/scales-in-f)]

With the given notes you can form the following chords:
F Major : F3, A3, C4
Bb Major : Bb3, D4, F4
C Major : C4, E4, G4
Eb Major : Eb4, G4, Bb4
F Major : F4, A4, C5
Ab Major : Ab4, C5, Eb5
Bb Major : Bb4, D5, F5

With those chords you could play the following chord progressions:
F Major - Bb Major - C Major - F Major
F Major - Eb Major - Ab Major - Bb Major
F Major - C Major - F Major - Bb Major

This is a limited set of chords and chord progressions, and you may want to experiment with omitting or adjusting certain notes to create different chord voicings and progressions that better fit the music you want to play.
[[1](https://www.becomesingers.com/vocal-range/vocal-range-chart)]

Additionally, you could also find some songs on platforms like SoundCloud that use only the notes you have available to you, like for example the song "Shang-Diao" by Muyuq Instrumentos en Armonía. [[3](https://soundcloud.com/muyuq-drum/shang-diao-f3-bb3-c4-eb4-f4)]

Keep in mind that the handpan is a relatively new instrument and not many songs are written specifically for it, so you may have to make some adjustments to the songs you find in order to play them on your handpan.
